intro: Symplocos patens, commonly known as the broadleaf sand cherry, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features alternate, ovate to elliptic leaves with a smooth upper surface and hairy undersides. Its small, white flowers appear in clusters and are followed by red, fleshy berries that are edible for some wildlife. Symplocos patens typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found in the understory of forests.
